response_deadline: 1 working day if no written procedures; reasonable procedures if adopted
notes: Each agency sets own procedures or defaults to 1 working day response. Current statute expires July 1, 2028. Written denials required with specific exemption citations.

basic_request.subject: Mississippi Public Records Act Request
basic_request.body:
Dear Records Custodian:

Pursuant to the Mississippi Public Records Act, Mississippi Code § 25-61-1 et seq., I respectfully request access to inspect and copy the following public records:

[SPECIFIC DESCRIPTION OF RECORDS]

If your agency has adopted written procedures for records access, please follow those procedures. If no written procedures exist, please provide access within one (1) working day as required by § 25-61-5.

If any portion of this request is denied, please provide a written denial containing a statement of the specific exemption relied upon as required by law.

I prefer to receive responsive records electronically when possible to minimize costs. Please contact me if clarification is needed.

Thank you for your attention to this matter.

Sincerely,
[YOUR NAME]
[YOUR ADDRESS]
[PHONE NUMBER]
[EMAIL ADDRESS]

appeal_template.subject: Appeal of Public Records Request Denial
appeal_template.body:
Dear [AGENCY HEAD]:

I am writing to appeal the denial of my Mississippi Public Records Act request dated [DATE]. Your office denied my request for [DESCRIPTION OF RECORDS] citing [EXEMPTION CLAIMED].

I believe this denial is improper under Mississippi law because [LEGAL REASONING]. The requested records appear to be public records that should be disclosed under § 25-61-1 et seq.

Please reconsider this denial and provide the requested records. Mississippi's Public Records Act declares all public records to be public property accessible to any person.

I look forward to your response.

Sincerely,
[YOUR NAME]
